page.title: 07FARMING - GENERAL
page.content: From a survey of Skelton farms the average size is 188.3 acres. The survey also showed that 84% of farmland was grass. Animals kept on farms were cows, sheep, ewes with lambs, bullocks and heifers. Crops grown were barley, typhon, turnips, hay and silage. Most farms are highly mechanised and machines include tractor, trailer, square bailer, muckspreader, slurry spreader, elevator, forager, mower, seed drill, plough and harrow. Very expensive machinery is hired as required. The average price of land is Â£2000 per acre. A good dairy cow can cost Â£750, a dairy calf Â£80 and a beef calf Â£150.
